homepage.trustedByMosques: ðŸ•Œ Beta Platform for Modern Mosques
homepage.heroDescription: A beta platform designed to help mosques digitize their khairat management and basic operations. Currently in development with core features being tested and refined.
homepage.featuresDescription: Everything you need to manage your mosque efficiently and engage your community effectively
homepage.mosqueManagementDescription: Complete profile management with public visibility controls, contact information, and service listings
homepage.eventsProgramsDescription: Organize and promote community events, educational programs, and special occasions
homepage.contributionManagementDescription: Manage khairat programs, track khairat contributions, and organize community support for families in need
homepage.communityFeaturesDescription: Connect community members with user management and family dependent tracking
homepage.securityPrivacyDescription: Enterprise-grade data protection with granular privacy controls and standards compliance
homepage.testimonialsDescription: We're actively developing and testing core features with selected mosques to ensure quality and reliability
homepage.communitySupportDescription: Direct support during beta testing phase as we develop and refine the platform
homepage.ctaDescription: We're currently in beta development focusing on khairat management. Contact us if you're interested in testing our platform
homepage.ctaNoCredit: Beta access â€¢ Paid service â€¢ Currently in development
homepage.brandTagline: Empowering mosques with modern digital solutions.
homepage.heroSubtitle: Find mosques and surau nearby. Manage khairat online.
homepage.searchPlaceholder: Search by mosque/surau name or location...
homepage.findMosqueDescription: Search and discover mosques and surau in your area
homepage.registerKhairatDescription: Apply for khairat membership at your chosen mosque
homepage.makeKhairatPaymentDescription: Contribute to the khairat fund to support your community
homepage.problemsSubtitle: We understand the unique challenges that modern mosques encounter in managing their communities and operations.
homepage.noOneKnowsDescription: Many community members don't know about your mosque's services, events, or how to get involved.
homepage.tooMuchPaperworkDescription: Forms and records are everywhere and difficult to manage.
homepage.khairatIsConfusingDescription: It's hard to track who needs help and who has paid.
homepage.manualProcessesDescription: Managing memberships, events, and contributions through spreadsheets and paper records is time-consuming and error-prone.
homepage.communityDisconnectDescription: It's difficult to keep community members engaged and informed about mosque activities and opportunities.
homepage.whatWeOfferSubtitle: A comprehensive platform designed specifically for mosque management and community engagement.
homepage.digitalKhairatDescription: Streamline khairat collection, tracking, and distribution with our digital platform.
homepage.onlinePaymentsDescription: Secure online payments for khairat contributions
homepage.mosqueProfilesDescription: Complete mosque information and services in one place
homepage.communityDescription: Connect and engage with your mosque community
homepage.registerKhairatFeatureDescription: Join khairat programs at your mosque and become a member
homepage.payKhairatFeatureDescription: Make khairat contributions online securely and easily
homepage.claimKhairatFeatureDescription: Submit claims for khairat benefits when needed
homepage.onlinePaymentFeatureDescription: Secure online payment processing for all transactions
homepage.mosquePageFeatureDescription: Discover mosque information, services, and community details
homepage.eventManagementDescription: Create, promote, and manage mosque events with ease.
homepage.communityDirectoryDescription: Maintain a digital directory of community members and their families.
homepage.securePaymentsDescription: Accept online contributions and payments securely.
homepage.testimonialsSubtitle: Hear from mosque administrators and community members who are using our platform.
homepage.testimonial1: This platform has transformed how we manage our mosque community. The digital khairat system alone has saved us hours of work every week.
homepage.testimonial2: Finally, a platform that understands the needs of modern mosques. The event management features have helped us increase community participation significantly.
homepage.testimonial3: This platform has made mosque management so much easier. Quick setup and comprehensive features.
homepage.readyToGetStartedSubtitle: Join the growing number of mosques that are modernizing their community management.
homepage.startManagingDescription: Complete platform to manage khairat, track payments, and connect with members easily.
homepage.footerDescription: Empowering mosques with modern digital solutions for better community management and engagement.

billing.pageSubtitle: Manage your subscription and billing preferences
billing.accessDeniedDescription: This page is only available to mosque administrators.
billing.invoicesSubtitle: View and manage your billing history and invoices

checkoutCanceled.title: Checkout canceled
checkoutCanceled.description: You canceled the billing process. No changes were made to your subscription.

checkoutSuccess.title: Checkout successful
checkoutSuccess.description: Your billing was successful. If your subscription status does not update immediately, it will refresh shortly.

billing.choosePlanSubtitle: Select the plan that best fits your mosque's needs

pricing.pickPlanDescription: Pick a plan that fits your community. Upgrade or cancel anytime.

faqs.canSwitchPlansAnswer: Yes. You can upgrade or downgrade at any time from your settings.
faqs.annualDiscounts: Do you offer discounts for annual billing?
faqs.annualDiscountsAnswer: Yes. Annual pricing saves about 20% compared to monthly.
faqs.paymentMethods: What payment methods do you accept?
faqs.paymentMethodsAnswer: We accept major credit cards, debit cards, and online banking through secure payment gateways. All transactions are encrypted and secure.
faqs.cancelSubscription: How do I cancel my subscription?
faqs.cancelSubscriptionAnswer: You can cancel your subscription at any time from your billing settings. Your account will remain active until the end of your current billing period.
faqs.dataSecurityAnswer: Yes. We use industry-standard encryption and security measures to protect your data. All information is stored securely and backed up regularly.
faqs.multipleMosques: Can I use this for multiple mosques?
faqs.multipleMosquesAnswer: Each subscription is for one mosque. If you manage multiple mosques, you'll need a separate subscription for each one.
faqs.exceedMemberLimit: What happens if I exceed my member limit?
faqs.exceedMemberLimitAnswer: If you exceed your plan's member limit, you'll need to upgrade to a higher plan. We'll notify you when you're approaching your limit.

pricing.readyToSetup: Ready to set up your mosque?
pricing.createProfileDescription: Create your profile and get set up in minutes.

mosqueSizeDescriptions.free: The perfect starting place for your small mosque & surau
mosqueSizeDescriptions.standard: The ideal solution for your growing mosque community
mosqueSizeDescriptions.pro: The complete platform for your large mosque organization

docs.title: Documentation
docs.subtitle: Learn how to use the mosque management platform

about.title: About khairatkita
about.description: Learn about the platform and its features
about.whatIsContent1: khairatkita is a modern digital platform designed to help mosques digitize their management operations and connect with their communities. The name "khairatkita" refers to our collective welfare - the community of members who regularly contribute and support those in need.
about.whatIsContent2: Our platform provides comprehensive tools for mosque administrators to manage welfare programs (khairat), handle member registrations, process payments, and maintain accurate records - all in one centralized, easy-to-use system.
about.missionIntro: We aim to modernize mosque operations by providing digital solutions that:
about.mission1: Simplify administrative tasks for mosque staff
about.mission2: Make it easier for community members to participate in mosque activities
about.mission4: Enable secure online payments and contributions
about.forMembers1: Find Mosques: Discover mosques in your area and learn about their services
about.forMembers2: Kariah Membership: Apply to become a registered member of your local mosque
about.forMembers3: Khairat Contributions: Make welfare contributions online securely
about.forMembers4: Payment History: Track all your contributions and payments
about.forMembers5: Dependents Management: Manage family member information
about.forMembers6: Claims: Submit requests for financial assistance when needed
about.forAdmins1: Mosque Page: Create and manage your mosque's public page
about.forAdmins2: Member Management: Review and manage kariah membership applications
about.forAdmins3: Khairat Management: Set up and manage welfare programs
about.forAdmins4: Payment Processing: Accept online and offline contributions
about.forAdmins5: Claims Processing: Review and process financial assistance requests
about.forAdmins6: Legacy Data Import: Import historical records and match them to current members
about.forAdmins7: Analytics & Reports: View statistics and generate reports
about.understandingKariahContent1: Kariah (also spelled "Kariah") refers to the registered members of a mosque community. Becoming a kariah member means:
about.understandingKariah1: You are officially registered with the mosque
about.understandingKariah2: You can participate in mosque programs and activities
about.understandingKariah3: You have access to mosque services and support
about.understandingKariah4: You can make contributions and receive assistance when needed
about.understandingKariahContent2: The kariah system helps mosques maintain accurate records of their community members and ensures that services and support are provided to registered members.
about.understandingKhairatContent1: Khairat is a welfare program where community members contribute financially to support families in need. The khairat system:
about.understandingKhairat1: Allows members to make regular or one-time contributions
about.understandingKhairat2: Provides financial assistance to families facing difficulties
about.understandingKhairat4: Keeps accurate records of all contributions and distributions
about.understandingKhairatContent2: Through khairatkita, mosques can digitize their khairat programs, making it easier for members to contribute and for administrators to manage the funds.
about.platformStatusContent1: Beta Platform: khairatkita is currently in beta testing phase. We are continuously improving the platform based on feedback from mosques and community members.
about.platformStatusContent2: Core features are being tested and refined. If you encounter any issues or have suggestions, please contact support.
about.forCommunityMembersContent: Start by creating an account, then browse mosques in your area. You can apply for kariah membership and begin making contributions to support your community.
about.forMosqueAdminsContent: Sign up as a mosque administrator, complete your mosque profile, and start managing your community digitally. Set up khairat programs and begin accepting online contributions.
about.needHelpContent: Explore our documentation to learn more about specific features. If you have questions or need assistance, please refer to the relevant guide pages or contact support.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Learn how to create an account and start using the mosque management platform
gettingStarted.step1Item1: Click the "Sign Up" button on the homepage
gettingStarted.step1Item2: Enter your email address and create a password
gettingStarted.step1Item3: Alternatively, sign up using your Google account
gettingStarted.step1Item4: Verify your email address if required
gettingStarted.step2Intro: After signing up, you'll be guided through the onboarding process:
gettingStarted.step2Item1: Enter your personal information (name, phone number, address)
gettingStarted.step2Item2a: Community Member: For regular mosque attendees
gettingStarted.step2Item2b: Mosque Administrator: For mosque staff (requires verification code)
gettingStarted.dashboardContent: Once you've completed onboarding, you'll land on your dashboard. This is your central hub where you can:
gettingStarted.dashboardItem1: View your recent activity and contributions
gettingStarted.dashboardItem2: See quick statistics about your participation
gettingStarted.dashboardItem3: Access quick actions for common tasks
gettingStarted.navigationContent: The sidebar navigation provides quick access to all features:
gettingStarted.navDashboardDesc: Your home page with overview of activities and statistics
gettingStarted.navMyMosquesDesc: Browse and join mosques, view your mosque memberships, and manage applications
gettingStarted.navContributionsDesc: Make khairat contributions and view your payment history
gettingStarted.navProfileDesc: Update your personal information and account settings
gettingStarted.nextStep1Content: Visit the "My Mosques" page to discover mosques in your area and join communities
gettingStarted.nextStep2Content: Support your mosque community by making a khairat contribution
gettingStarted.nextStep3Content: Add your dependents and update your profile information
gettingStarted.needHelpContent: If you encounter any issues or have questions, please refer to the other documentation pages or contact support.

guides.aboutDesc: Learn about the platform and its features
guides.gettingStartedDesc: Learn how to create an account and navigate the platform
guides.myMosquesDesc: Discover and join mosques in your area
guides.adminGettingStartedDesc: Set up your mosque and configure the platform
guides.mosqueProfileDesc: Manage your mosque information and settings
guides.khairatManagementDesc: Create programs, manage applications, and process claims
guides.paymentsDesc: Configure payment gateways and manage subscriptions

myMosques.title: My Mosques
myMosques.description: Discover and join mosques in your area, manage memberships, and view your mosque-related activities
myMosques.pageDescription: View and manage your khairat memberships and applications
myMosques.joinYourFirstMosqueDescription: Connect with mosques in your community and participate in khairat programs to make meaningful payments.
myMosques.browseItem1: Navigate to "My Mosques" from the sidebar
myMosques.browseItem2: Use the search bar to find mosques by name or location
myMosques.browseItem3: Filter mosques by city, state, or services offered
myMosques.browseItem4: Click on a mosque to view its public page
myMosques.kariahApplicationDesc: To become a member of a mosque, you need to apply for Kariah membership:
myMosques.kariahItem1: Find the mosque you want to join
myMosques.kariahItem2: Click "Apply for Kariah Membership" on the mosque profile
myMosques.kariahItem3: Fill out the application form with your details
myMosques.kariahItem5: Wait for mosque administrators to review and approve your application
myMosques.applicationStatusDesc: You can track your application status in the "My Mosques" page under the "Applications" tab. You'll receive notifications when your application is approved or if additional information is needed.
myMosques.viewingMembershipsDesc: The "My Mosques" page has several tabs to help you manage your mosque relationships:
myMosques.myMosquesTabDesc: View all mosques where you are an active member. This includes mosques where your Kariah application has been approved.
myMosques.applicationsTabDesc: Track the status of your Kariah membership applications. You can see pending, approved, or rejected applications here.
myMosques.paymentHistoryTabDesc: View all your contributions and payments made to mosques, including both current and legacy records.
myMosques.claimsTabDesc: View and track any khairat claims you've submitted to mosques.
myMosques.tip1Content: Make sure your profile information is complete before applying. This helps mosque administrators process your application faster.
myMosques.tip2Content: Mosque administrators review applications manually. It may take a few days for your application to be processed.
myMosques.tip3Content: You can be a member of multiple mosques. Each membership is independent and managed separately.

khairat.title: Khairat Contributions
khairat.description: Learn how to make contributions to welfare programs and manage your payment history
khairat.whatIsContent: Khairat is a welfare program that allows community members to contribute financially to support families in need. Your contributions help provide assistance to community members during difficult times.
khairat.contributionItem1: Navigate to "Contributions" from the sidebar (or "My Khairat")
khairat.contributionItem3: Select the mosque and khairat program you want to contribute to
khairat.paymentMethodsDesc: The available payment methods depend on what the mosque has configured:
khairat.paymentMethod3: Cash payment (marked as pending until confirmed by admin)
khairat.viewingHistoryDesc: You can view all your contributions and payments in the "Payment History" tab:
khairat.paymentDetailsDesc: Each payment record shows the amount, date, program name, payment method, and status (completed, pending, failed).
khairat.legacyRecordsDesc: Historical payment records imported by mosque administrators are marked with a "Legacy" badge. These records preserve your contribution history from before the platform was implemented.
khairat.searchFilterDesc: Use the search bar to find specific payments by program name, date, or amount. You can also filter by payment status or date range.
khairat.submittingClaimDesc: If you need financial assistance, you can submit a khairat claim to your mosque:
khairat.claimItem1: Go to the "Contributions" or "My Khairat" page
khairat.claimItem2: Click "Submit Claim" or navigate to the Claims tab
khairat.claimFormItem2: Provide a title and description of your need
khairat.claimFormItem3: Select the priority level (low, medium, high)
khairat.claimItem5: Track the status of your claim in the Claims tab
khairat.claimReviewDesc: Mosque administrators review all claims. You'll receive notifications when your claim status changes (pending, approved, rejected, or paid). Be patient as the review process may take some time.
khairat.tip1Content: Consider setting up regular contributions to support your mosque community consistently.
khairat.tip2Content: Your payment history is automatically saved. You can download or print records for your personal records if needed.
khairat.tip3Content: When submitting a claim, provide clear and detailed information about your need. This helps administrators make informed decisions.

dependents.title: Managing Dependents
dependents.description: Add and manage family members and dependents in your account
dependents.whatAreContent: Dependents are family members or individuals you want to manage under your account. This feature allows you to keep track of family members for khairat programs, applications, and other mosque-related activities.
dependents.importantInfo2: This information may be used for khairat applications and claims
dependents.viewingDependentsDesc: The Dependents page displays all your added dependents in a table format. You can see:
dependents.editItem1: Find the dependent you want to edit in the table
dependents.editItem2: Click the "Edit" button (or icon) for that dependent
dependents.editItem3: Update the information in the form
dependents.removeItem1: Find the dependent you want to remove
dependents.removeItem3: Confirm the deletion in the popup dialog
dependents.warning: Warning: Removing a dependent cannot be undone. Make sure you want to delete this information before confirming.
dependents.usingDependentsDesc: Dependents can be used in various ways throughout the platform:
dependents.usingItem1Desc: When applying for khairat programs, you can include dependents in your application.
dependents.usingItem2Desc: Dependents can be listed as beneficiaries in khairat claims.
dependents.usingItem3Desc: Keep a centralized record of your family members for easy reference.
dependents.tip1Content: Regularly update dependent information, especially contact details and addresses, to ensure accurate records.
dependents.tip2Content: Double-check IC numbers when adding dependents. These are used for verification and matching records.
dependents.tip3Content: Dependent information is private and only visible to you and mosque administrators when relevant to applications or claims.

profile.title: Profile & Settings
profile.description: Manage your personal information, account settings, and preferences
profile.accessingProfileDesc: Navigate to "Profile" from the sidebar to access your personal information and account settings.
profile.updatingInfoDesc: You can update the following information:
profile.infoItem4: Email: Your account email (may require verification)
profile.profilePictureDesc: You can upload or change your profile picture. Supported formats include JPG, PNG, and other common image formats.
profile.passwordItem4: Enter your new password (must meet security requirements)
profile.languagePreferencesDesc: Change the interface language if multiple languages are supported. Your preference will be saved and applied across all pages.
profile.twoFactorDesc: If available, enable two-factor authentication for additional account security. This requires a verification code in addition to your password when signing in.
profile.activeSessionsDesc: View and manage active login sessions. You can sign out from devices you no longer use or don't recognize.
profile.deletingAccountDesc: If you need to delete your account, you can find this option in the Settings section. Please note:
profile.deletionItem1: Account deletion is permanent and cannot be undone
profile.deletionItem2: All your personal data will be removed
profile.deletionItem3: Payment history may be retained for mosque records (as per policy)
profile.deletionItem4: You may need to contact support for assistance
profile.tip1Content: Regularly update your contact information to ensure you receive important notifications and updates.
profile.tip2Content: Use a strong, unique password for your account. Consider using a password manager to generate and store secure passwords.
profile.tip3Content: Periodically review your account settings and privacy preferences to ensure they match your current needs.

adminGettingStarted.title: Admin Getting Started
adminGettingStarted.description: Learn how to set up and manage your mosque on the platform
adminGettingStarted.setupItem1: Sign up for an account or log in
adminGettingStarted.setupItem2: During onboarding, select "Mosque Administrator" as your account type
adminGettingStarted.setupItem3: Enter the admin verification code (provided by your mosque or platform)
adminGettingStarted.setupItem4: Select your admin role (Imam, Board Member, Treasurer, etc.)
adminGettingStarted.verificationCodeDesc: The admin verification code ensures only authorized personnel can create administrator accounts. Keep this code secure and only share it with trusted mosque staff members.
adminGettingStarted.checklist1Desc: Complete your mosque's public page with name, address, contact information, and services offered.
adminGettingStarted.checklist1Action: Go to: Mosque Page â†’ Complete all required fields
adminGettingStarted.checklist2Desc: Set up your first khairat (welfare) program to start accepting contributions from community members.
adminGettingStarted.checklist2Action: Go to: Khairat â†’ Programs Tab â†’ Create Program
adminGettingStarted.checklist3Desc: Set up payment gateways (Stripe, bank transfer, etc.) to enable online contributions.
adminGettingStarted.checklist3Action: Go to: Settings â†’ Payment Settings
adminGettingStarted.checklist4Desc: Check your subscription status and ensure you have access to all needed features.
adminGettingStarted.checklist4Action: Go to: Billing â†’ View current plan
adminGettingStarted.dashboardDesc: Your admin dashboard provides an overview of your mosque's activities:
adminGettingStarted.navDashboardDesc: Overview of mosque activities, statistics, and quick actions
adminGettingStarted.navKhairatDesc: Manage khairat programs, applications, claims, payments, and legacy data
adminGettingStarted.navMosqueProfileDesc: Manage mosque information, settings, and public page
adminGettingStarted.navBillingDesc: View subscription status, manage payment methods, and billing history
adminGettingStarted.nextStep1Content: Start by setting up your mosque profile with all necessary information. This is the foundation for all other features.
adminGettingStarted.nextStep2Content: Configure payment gateways to start accepting online contributions from community members.
adminGettingStarted.nextStep3Content: Create a khairat program to begin accepting contributions and managing welfare activities.
adminGettingStarted.needHelpContent: Refer to the other admin documentation pages for detailed guides on specific features. Each section provides step-by-step instructions for managing different aspects of your mosque operations.

adminMosqueProfile.title: Mosque Page Management
adminMosqueProfile.description: Manage your mosque information, settings, and public page visibility
adminMosqueProfile.accessingProfileDesc: Navigate to "Mosque Page" from the sidebar to access all mosque management settings.
adminMosqueProfile.requiredItem1: Mosque Name: Official name of your mosque
adminMosqueProfile.requiredItem2: Address: Complete address including street, city, state, and postal code
adminMosqueProfile.requiredItem3: Contact Information: Phone number and email
adminMosqueProfile.requiredItem4: Location: Set location on map for accurate geolocation
adminMosqueProfile.logoItem2: Select an image file (JPG, PNG recommended)
adminMosqueProfile.logoItem3: Recommended size: 512x512 pixels or larger (square format)
adminMosqueProfile.logoItem4: Logo will appear on your public page and dashboard
adminMosqueProfile.bannerItem1: Upload a banner image for your dashboard header
adminMosqueProfile.bannerItem2: Recommended size: 1920x400 pixels or similar wide format
adminMosqueProfile.bannerItem3: This image appears at the top of your admin dashboard
adminMosqueProfile.guideline1: Use high-quality images for best results
adminMosqueProfile.guideline3: Ensure images are appropriate and represent your mosque well
adminMosqueProfile.servicesDesc: Configure which services your mosque offers. This information appears on your public page and helps users find mosques with specific services:
adminMosqueProfile.serviceKhairatDesc: Enable if your mosque offers khairat (welfare) programs for community support.
adminMosqueProfile.serviceKariahDesc: Enable if you accept kariah membership applications from community members.
adminMosqueProfile.serviceOrgDesc: Enable if you manage organizational structures and people within your mosque.
adminMosqueProfile.publicPrivateDesc: Control who can see your mosque page:
adminMosqueProfile.publicProfileDesc: Your mosque appears in search results and can be viewed by anyone. This is recommended for most mosques to help community members find you.
adminMosqueProfile.privateProfileDesc: Your mosque is not listed in public search. Only members with direct links can access the page.
adminMosqueProfile.viewingPublicDesc: You can preview how your mosque appears to the public:
adminMosqueProfile.viewingItem1: From the dashboard, click "View Mosque Page" button
adminMosqueProfile.viewingItem3: Review all information as it appears to visitors
adminMosqueProfile.viewingItem4: Make any necessary adjustments to the profile
adminMosqueProfile.tip1Content: Fill out all available information to help community members find and learn about your mosque.
adminMosqueProfile.tip2Content: Regularly review and update contact information, operating hours, and service offerings to ensure accuracy.
adminMosqueProfile.tip3Content: Use high-quality images and write clear, professional descriptions to present your mosque in the best light.

adminKhairat.title: Khairat Management
adminKhairat.description: Complete guide to managing khairat programs, applications, claims, and payments
adminKhairat.overviewDesc: The Khairat management section is your central hub for all welfare program activities. It's organized into tabs for easy navigation: Programs, Applications, Claims, Payments, and Legacy Data.
adminKhairat.createItem1: Navigate to Khairat â†’ Programs tab
adminKhairat.manageItem1: View all programs in a table with key statistics
adminKhairat.manageItem2: Edit program details by clicking on a program
adminKhairat.manageItem3: Deactivate programs that are no longer active
adminKhairat.manageItem4: View contribution statistics for each program
adminKhairat.reviewingDesc: Community members can apply to join khairat programs. You'll see all applications here:
adminKhairat.reviewItem1: View pending applications in the Applications tab
adminKhairat.reviewItem2: Click on an application to see full details
adminKhairat.reviewItem3: Review applicant information and dependents (if any)
adminKhairat.bulkDesc: You can process multiple applications at once:
adminKhairat.bulkItem2: Choose bulk approve or bulk reject
adminKhairat.processingDesc: Members can submit claims for financial assistance. Manage all claims here:
adminKhairat.claimItem1: View all claims in the Claims tab
adminKhairat.claimItem2: Filter by status (pending, approved, rejected, paid)
adminKhairat.claimItem3: Click on a claim to view full details
adminKhairat.claimItem4: Review the requested amount and description
adminKhairat.claimItem5: Approve, reject, or request more information
adminKhairat.claimItem6: Mark as paid when payment is processed
adminKhairat.workflowPending: Pending â†’ Initial claim submitted by member
adminKhairat.workflowReview: Under Review â†’ You're reviewing the claim
adminKhairat.workflowApproved: Approved â†’ Claim approved, ready for payment
adminKhairat.workflowPaid: Paid â†’ Payment processed to member
adminKhairat.priorityDesc: Claims are marked with priority levels:
adminKhairat.priorityHigh: High: Urgent cases requiring immediate attention
adminKhairat.contributionsDesc: Track all contributions made to your khairat programs:
adminKhairat.contribItem1: See all payments in chronological order
adminKhairat.contribItem2: Filter by program, date range, or status
adminKhairat.contribItem3: View payment method and transaction details
adminKhairat.contribItem4: Export payment data for accounting purposes
adminKhairat.statusPendingPay: Pending: Payment initiated but not yet confirmed
adminKhairat.statusFailed: Failed: Payment could not be processed
adminKhairat.manualDesc: For cash or bank transfer payments, you can manually record them:
adminKhairat.manualItem4: Choose payment method (cash, bank transfer, etc.)
adminKhairat.manualItem5: Add any notes or reference numbers
adminKhairat.importingDesc: If you have historical payment records from before using the platform, you can import them:
adminKhairat.importItem1: Prepare a CSV file with your historical data
adminKhairat.importItem5: Preview the data to ensure it's correct
adminKhairat.matchingDesc: After importing, match legacy records to current users:
adminKhairat.matchItem1: View unmatched records in the table
adminKhairat.matchItem3: Search for the user by name or IC number
adminKhairat.matchItem6: Users will then see these records in their payment history
adminKhairat.bulkMatchDesc: For efficiency, you can match multiple records at once:
adminKhairat.bulkMatchItem3: Follow the matching process for each record
adminKhairat.csvDesc: Your CSV file should include columns for:
adminKhairat.tip1Content: Review applications and claims regularly to ensure timely processing and good member experience.
adminKhairat.tip2Content: Use notes and comments to document decisions and communicate with team members about specific cases.
adminKhairat.tip3Content: When importing legacy data, take time to match records accurately. This ensures members have complete payment histories.

adminMembers.title: Member Management
adminMembers.description: Manage kariah members, review applications, and maintain member records
adminMembers.overviewDesc: Member management allows you to oversee all kariah (mosque community) members, review membership applications, and maintain accurate member records.
adminMembers.reviewingDesc: Community members can apply to become kariah members of your mosque. Review and process these applications:
adminMembers.reviewItem1: Navigate to the appropriate section (usually in Khairat or dedicated Members page)
adminMembers.reviewItem3: Click on an application to see full details:
adminMembers.criteriaDesc: Consider the following when reviewing applications:
adminMembers.viewingDesc: Access a complete list of all active kariah members:
adminMembers.viewItem1: View member list in table format
adminMembers.viewItem2: See member names, IC numbers, and contact information
adminMembers.detailsDesc: Click on a member to view detailed information:
adminMembers.detailPersonal: Personal Information: Name, IC, contact details
adminMembers.detailHistory: Membership History: Join date, status, renewal dates
adminMembers.detailContributions: Contributions: Payment history and total contributions
adminMembers.statusActive: Active: Member is currently active and in good standing
adminMembers.updateItem1: Find the member in the member list
adminMembers.updateItem2: Click on the member to open details
adminMembers.updateItem5: Add a reason if required (for suspensions)
adminMembers.statsDesc: View comprehensive statistics about your members:
adminMembers.statTotalDesc: Count of all active kariah members
adminMembers.statNewDesc: Members who joined in a specific time period
adminMembers.exportDesc: Export member information for reporting or external use:
adminMembers.exportItem1: Navigate to the member management section
adminMembers.exportItem2: Apply any filters if you want specific members
adminMembers.privacyDesc: When exporting member data, ensure you comply with data protection regulations. Only export what is necessary and keep exported files secure.
adminMembers.tip1Content: Review applications promptly to provide good service to potential members. Set a regular schedule for reviewing applications.
adminMembers.tip2Content: Keep member information up to date. Regularly verify contact information and membership status.
adminMembers.tip3Content: When rejecting applications or changing member status, provide clear reasons. This helps maintain transparency and trust.

adminPayments.title: Payment & Billing
adminPayments.description: Configure payment gateways, manage subscriptions, and handle billing
adminPayments.configDesc: To accept online contributions, you need to set up payment gateways:
adminPayments.configItem1: Navigate to Settings â†’ Payment Settings
adminPayments.configItem3: Enter your API keys and credentials:
adminPayments.securityDesc: Never share your secret API keys. These should only be entered in the secure settings page and never shared publicly.
adminPayments.viewingDesc: Check your subscription status and plan details:
adminPayments.viewItem1: Navigate to Billing from the sidebar
adminPayments.viewItem2: View your current plan and features
adminPayments.viewItem4: Check billing cycle and next payment date
adminPayments.planStandard: Standard: Full features for small to medium mosques
adminPayments.methodsDesc: Set up and manage how you pay for your subscription:
adminPayments.methodItem1: Go to Billing â†’ Payment Methods
adminPayments.methodItem3: Enter card details or bank information
adminPayments.invoicesDesc: Access all your billing history and invoices:
adminPayments.invoiceItem2: View list of all past invoices
adminPayments.invoiceItem3: Click on an invoice to view details
adminPayments.onlineItem1: Payments are processed automatically through your configured gateway
adminPayments.onlineItem2: You'll receive notifications for new payments
adminPayments.onlineItem3: Payments appear in the Payments tab immediately
adminPayments.onlineItem4: Failed payments are marked and can be retried
adminPayments.manualPayDesc: For cash or bank transfer payments:
adminPayments.manualPayItem1: Go to Khairat â†’ Payments tab
adminPayments.tip1Content: Keep your payment gateway API keys secure. Never share them or commit them to version control. Rotate keys periodically for security.
adminPayments.tip2Content: Regularly review payment transactions to ensure everything is processing correctly. Set up alerts for failed payments or unusual activity.
adminPayments.tip3Content: Ensure your subscription payment method is always current to avoid service interruptions. Update cards before they expire.

adminLegacyData.title: Legacy Data Import
adminLegacyData.description: Import and match historical payment records from before using the platform
adminLegacyData.whatIsDesc: Legacy data refers to historical payment and contribution records from before your mosque started using this platform. Importing this data allows you to:
adminLegacyData.whatIsItem1: Preserve complete payment history for members
adminLegacyData.whatIsItem2: Maintain accurate records across the transition
adminLegacyData.whatIsItem3: Provide members with their full contribution history
adminLegacyData.whatIsItem4: Generate comprehensive reports with historical data
adminLegacyData.csvDesc: Your legacy data should be in CSV (Comma-Separated Values) format. The file should include the following columns:
adminLegacyData.optCol2: Payment Method: Cash, bank transfer, etc.
adminLegacyData.qualityDesc: Before importing, ensure your data is:
adminLegacyData.qualityItem1: Properly formatted (no extra spaces, consistent date formats)
adminLegacyData.qualityItem5: Saved in UTF-8 encoding (for proper character display)
adminLegacyData.uploadItem1: Navigate to Khairat â†’ Legacy Data tab
adminLegacyData.uploadItem3: Select your CSV file from your computer
adminLegacyData.uploadItem4: Wait for the file to be processed
adminLegacyData.previewItem1: Check that columns are mapped correctly
adminLegacyData.uploadItem6: Click "Upload" or "Import" to complete the process
adminLegacyData.uploadItem7: Records will appear in the table (initially unmatched)
adminLegacyData.validationDesc: The system will validate your data during upload. Common issues include:
adminLegacyData.validationNote: Fix any errors before proceeding with the import.
adminLegacyData.individualDesc: After uploading, match each legacy record to a current user:
adminLegacyData.indMatchItem1: View unmatched records in the Legacy Data table
adminLegacyData.indMatchItem8: The record is now linked and visible to the user
adminLegacyData.autoDesc: The system can help with matching:
adminLegacyData.autoItem1: IC numbers are automatically checked against existing users
adminLegacyData.autoItem2: Suggestions are provided when potential matches are found
adminLegacyData.bulkMatchDesc: For efficiency, match multiple records at once:
adminLegacyData.bulkMatchItem3: For each record, follow the matching process:
adminLegacyData.bulkMatchItem4: Complete all matches in the batch
adminLegacyData.viewingMatchedDesc: Once matched, records are visible to users in their payment history:
adminLegacyData.unmatchDesc: If you need to correct a match:
adminLegacyData.unmatchItem1: Find the matched record in the table
adminLegacyData.statsDesc: The Legacy Data tab provides statistics about your imported records:
adminLegacyData.statTotalDesc: Total number of legacy records imported
adminLegacyData.statAmountDesc: Sum of all legacy contribution amounts
adminLegacyData.tip1Content: If you have a large amount of legacy data, consider importing in batches to ensure accuracy and make matching more manageable.
adminLegacyData.tip2Content: Always double-check matches, especially when IC numbers are similar. Incorrect matches can cause confusion for members.
adminLegacyData.tip3Content: Keep a backup of your original CSV files before importing. This allows you to re-import if needed or reference the original data.
adminLegacyData.tip4Content: Some records may not match existing users (e.g., members who haven't joined the platform yet). You can match these later when users register.
